qas.question: When may sunlight be stored as gravitational potential energy?
This drives many weather phenomena, save those generated by volcanic events.
What is an example of a solar-mediated weather event?
What occurs when large unstable areas of warm ocean, heated over months, give up some of their thermal energy suddenly to power a few days of violent air movement?
When may sunlight be stored as gravitational kinetic energy?
This drives no weather phenomena, save those generated by volcanic events.
What is an example of a water-mediated weather event?
after being released at a wind powered dam, it can be used to drive turbines or generators to produce what?
What occurs when large unstable areas of warm ocean, heated over months, give up some of their thermal energy suddenly to power a few days of violent air movement?

context: Sunlight may be stored as gravitational potential energy <a0_0><b4_0>after it strikes the Earth<b4_0/><a0_0/>, as (for example) water evaporates from oceans and is deposited upon mountains (where, after being released at a hydroelectric dam, it can be used to drive turbines or generators to produce <b7_0>electricity<b7_0/>). <a1_0><b5_0>Sunlight<b5_0/><a1_0/> also drives many weather phenomena, save those generated by volcanic events. An example of a solar-mediated weather event is a <a2_0><a3_0><b6_0><b8_0>hurricane<b8_0/><b6_0/><a3_0/><a2_0/>, which occurs when large unstable areas of warm ocean, heated over months, give up some of their thermal energy suddenly to power a few days of violent air movement.
